en: I'm not going to see you again.
zh: 我不会再见你了。

en: I'm so sorry.

en: Some people think eating at home is better for you than eating out.

en: They say that in America anyone can become president, but perhaps that's not really true.

zh: 这总有一天可能会派上用场。

zh: 我刚上大学时最惊讶的是，我的同学中很少有人知道如何高效学习。

en: What would you do in a situation like this?

en: What would you do in this situation?

en: When I study a foreign language, I like to study with a native speaker of that language.
zh: 当我学习一门外语时，我喜欢和以该语言为母语的人一起学习。

en: When we started out, there were things we didn't know.

en: Which foreign language do you think is the easiest for native English speakers to learn?

en: Who do you think would do such a thing?

zh: 你认为谁在墙上写了那些涂鸦？

en: Would you like to go out and get something to eat?

en: Would you like to go to the park later this afternoon?

en: Would you rather have a cup of coffee or a cup of tea?

en: You don't know how to do it, do you?

en: You have to answer all of these questions.

en: You look European.

en: You sure have a nice singing voice!

en: You're really a good driver.

en: You're the only person I know that has ever visited Boston.
zh: 你是我认识的唯一一个去过波士顿的人。

en: Your English is grammatically correct, but sometimes what you say just doesn't sound like what a native speaker would say.
zh: 你的英语在语法上是正确的，但有时你说的话听起来不像母语人士会说的话。

en: He wants to kiss her.

en: I'm 25 years old.

en: Your face gives away whatever's on your mind right away, so there's no way you can keep a secret.
zh: 你的表情会立刻出卖你心里想的事情，所以你根本无法保守秘密。

en: Oh no... I tried so hard to keep the plan secret from my mom, but she already found out.
zh: 哦，不……我努力想对妈妈保密这个计划，但她已经发现了。

en: Last night was very hot and muggy and it was difficult to sleep.

en: Last night was very hot and muggy, so I didn't sleep so well.
zh: 昨晚非常闷热，所以我睡得不太好。

en: Listen, you can hear all the frogs starting to croak outside. At first I found them annoying, but I've gotten used to them now.

en: All quiet on the Western Front.

en: Life's short.

en: I'm drunk.

en: Lucy called already?

en: The town where I was born is beautiful.

en: Maybe you're right, after all.

en: Come on now, stop whimpering all the time, let's go somewhere for a change of mood.

en: Mr. Suzuki's classes are interesting, but his stories always get sidetracked, so we never make any good progress in our textbooks.

en: It is possible for us to know what has been achieved in the past, but it is not possible for us to change it. And it is possible for us to change the future, but it is not possible for us to know what will be achieved in it.
zh: 我们有可能知道过去已经取得的成就，但我们不可能改变它。而且我们有可能改变未来，但我们不可能知道未来会取得什么成就。

en: I want to know.

en: Translating this text will be very easy.

en: No one likes war.

en: The mountain is green.

en: If you get bit by a rabid dog, you'll need a tetanus shot.

en: Don't drink too much, okay?

en: The file is corrupt.

en: I think that it's you.

en: The house was surrounded by fields.

en: She's worrying for your safety.

en: Burn this letter after you finish reading it.

en: This problem is only of secondary importance.

en: Come back home.

en: This CD belongs to my son.

en: She was wearing a strange hat.

en: Ignorance does not protect against punishment.

en: He is truly sick.
zh: 他真的病了。

en: I used to drink a lot of cola, but now I drink only water.
zh: 我以前常喝很多可乐，但现在只喝水。

en: Love is blind, but jealousy can see even nonexistent things.
zh: 爱情是盲目的，但嫉妒甚至能看到不存在的东西。

en: A person's way of looking at something depends on his situation.

en: How one views something depends on one's situation.

en: Your way of looking at something depends on your situation.
zh: 你看待事物的方式取决于你的处境。

en: He proposed that we take a small break.
zh: 他提议我们休息一下。

en: May I have a moment of your time?

en: How many students are there in your university?

en: Stop pretending to not understand.
zh: 别装作听不懂。

en: May all of your wishes come true!
zh: 祝你心想事成！

en: Afghanistan and Iran both changed their national anthems several times in the course of the 20th century.
zh: 阿富汗和伊朗在20世纪都多次更换国歌。

en: You might be right.
zh: 你可能是对的。

en: The train station will be closed from tomorrow.
zh: 火车站从明天起关闭。

en: That station will be retired as of tomorrow.
zh: 那个车站从明天起停用。

en: Do you think that Steve Jobs would have been as successful as he has been if his last name were "Joobs" instead?
zh: 你认为如果史蒂夫·乔布斯姓“Joobs”而不是“Jobs”，他还会像现在这样成功吗？

en: She's not from here. She was born out of country.
zh: 她不是本地人。她出生在国外。

en: Thousands of dead fish have been found floating in the lake.
zh: 在湖里发现了成千上万条死鱼漂浮着。

en: "Mein Kampf" is a book by Adolf Hitler.
zh: 《我的奋斗》是阿道夫·希特勒写的一本书。

en: We should never judge people by their appearance.
zh: 我们永远不应该以貌取人。

en: I do have a crush, but it's not mutual. He already has a lovely wife, anyways.
zh: 我确实有喜欢的人，但不是两情相悦。反正他已经有个可爱的妻子了。

en: Please just leave me alone.
zh: 请让我一个人静静。

en: If Kyosuke comes to visit, tell him I'm not in. I don't want to see him anymore.
zh: 如果恭介来访，告诉他我不在。我不想再见到他了。

en: Stop being so selfish. The red shoes you wanted are sold out, and only the blue ones are left.
zh: 别这么自私。你想要的红色鞋子卖完了，只剩下蓝色的了。

en: The children on the beach are building a sand castle.
zh: 海滩上的孩子们正在建造沙堡。

en: She's not from here. She was born abroad.
zh: 她不是本地人。她出生在国外。

en: Time is like a river; it does not return to its source.
zh: 时间就像一条河流；它不会回到源头。

en: The conquered are always wrong. History considers nothing but their defeat.
zh: 征服者永远是对的。历史只考虑他们的失败。

en: My nose is really big, and it's crooked as well.
zh: 我的鼻子真的很大，而且还是歪的。

en: I am learning Japanese.
zh: 我在学习日语。

en: I am studying Japanese.
zh: 我在学习日语。

en: Tomorrow, I will ask him.
zh: 明天，我会问他。

en: Please don't be so surprised that I'm speaking this language and listen to the content of what I'm actually saying.
zh: 请不要因为我说这种语言而如此惊讶，听听我实际在说什么的内容。

en: What did you say yesterday?
zh: 你昨天说了什么？

en: Tom plans to live in Boston for more than a year.
zh: 汤姆计划在波士顿住一年以上。

en: I think it'll take more than a year to finish building our house.
zh: 我认为完成我们房子的建造需要一年以上的时间。

en: Tom hasn't seen Mary for more than a year.
zh: 汤姆已经一年多没见过玛丽了。

en: This is not a cat. This is a dog.
zh: 这不是猫。这是一条狗。

en: Somehow you don't sound too good today. Is anything the matter?
zh: 你今天听起来不太好啊。 怎么了？

en: To tell the truth, things at home haven't been going too well...we're thinking of getting a divorce.
zh: 说实话，最近家里不太顺...我们正在考虑离婚。

en: Watching the cat sleeping makes me feel better.
zh: 看着猫睡觉，我感觉好多了。

en: These glasses aren't right for my eyes anymore; it's difficult to see. I'm going to have to get a new pair made.
zh: 这副眼镜不适合我的眼睛了，看东西很困难。 我得去配一副新的了。

en: We had arranged to meet at 10, but, even now, I have had any contact from them at all. You don't think they got into an accident somewhere or something?
zh: 我们约好10点见面，但是到现在为止，我还没有收到他们的任何消息。 你不觉得他们是不是在哪里出了什么事故？

en: Even though we were supposed to meet at 10, I've had no contact with them. I wonder if they've had an accident.
zh: 我们本来约好10点见面，但我一直没联系上他们。 我想知道他们是不是出事故了。

en: The humidity is 80%?! It must be really humid!
zh: 湿度80%？！ 一定很潮湿！

en: The humidity is 80%?! It must be really close!

en: Why are you always late?

en: My neighbor is having some work done on his roof starting tomorrow, so he came to let me know about it. "There might be a lot of dust, so I apologize beforehand. Thank you in advance."
zh: 我的邻居明天开始要修屋顶，所以他来告诉我一声。“可能会有很多灰尘，我事先向您道歉。提前感谢您。”

en: It may seem obvious, but sentences you write yourself look the most natural.
zh: 这可能看起来很明显，但是你自己写的句子看起来最自然。

en: Fundamentally, you're not practicing anything by translating, so even if you say that you can't do it, once you've set your sights on a similar sentence you've seen before that is more natural yet does not quite convey the original sentence's nuances, translation proves to be an act that is quite addicting.
zh: 从根本上说，你通过翻译练习不了任何东西，所以即使你说你做不到，一旦你把目光投向一个你以前见过的类似句子，这个句子更自然，但又不能完全表达原文的细微差别，翻译就被证明是一种非常容易上瘾的行为。

en: I heard that a Perfume song is used in Cars 2.
zh: 我听说一首Perfume的歌被用在了《赛车总动员2》里。

en: My family belongs to the neighborhood association.

en: I worry that, because the Japanese lines in this site are written with furigana, they take up a lot of space, and the people who don't even care about them in the first place might find them annoying.
zh: 我担心，因为这个网站上的日语行都写了假名，它们占用了很大的空间，那些根本不在乎它们的人可能会觉得它们很烦人。

en: I'm not sleepy.

en: I wish you your happiness. Not like fortunes and such, but everything will surely be all right no matter what happens.

en: He bought a car.

en: Well, just do your best in your own time.

en: I'm free anytime.

en: You can't remember it and I'll never forget it.
